result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian D. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid to the Agent.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant's record shall be expunged per Section 973.015 Wis Stats if probation is successfully completed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian D. Smith

defendant.name: Smith, Adrian D.
defendant.address: 150 S. Main Street, Apt. 1, Clintonville, WI 54929

records.addlTxt:
Bond Terminated Slip
c: WC Jail

ADA Kurczewski appeared for the state.
Defendant appeared in person with Atty. Tom Johnson.
The state has complied with victim notification requirements; victim statement read by ADA Kurczewski.
Plea quest. and waiver of rights form filed.
The defendant enters a plea of guilty to the sole count in the complaint.  Plea accepted by the Court after rights were explained, and the defendant was found guilty.
Statements by counsel.
The Court sentences the defendant to 60 days in jail, with huber privileges. That sentence is stayed and the defendant is placed on probation for a period of 1 year.
Conditions: defendant to pay all court costs and supervision fees, undergo and complete all assessments and counseling deemed appropriate by the agent and abide by all treatment recommendations.
The Court will order expungement per Sec. 973.015 if all conditions are successfully completed.
Appeal rights were provided.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 7, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Bond recommendations by counsel.
$1,000.00 signature bond.
Cond: Report within 21 days to the Waupaca County Sheriff's Department to submit to the booking process.  You are required to make an appointment by calling (715) 942-1887. 
Defendant to have no contact directly or indirectly with victim.  Incidental contact in a school setting will not be a violation.
STC - BR 1 to schedule
